newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia to spend 255 bln rupiah on rice project.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia to spend 255 bln rupiah on rice project.

text.p: Indonesia said on Wednesday it planned to invest around 255.9 billion rupiah in the 1997 fiscal year starting April 1 to build infrastructure facilities for a one million hectare rice project in Central Kalimantan.
Public Works Minister Radinal Moochtar said in a statement to a parliamentary committee hearing that his ministry had already built irrigation facilities for the state project.
He said the ministry planned to build other infrastructure facilities, including housing and transportation, in the project area this year.
The project is aimed at reducing Indonesia's dependence on rice imports and ensuring self-sufficiency in the staple.
The U.S. embassy said in a report late last year that Indonesia was expected to import 1.3 million tonnes of rice in 1996, compared with an estimated 3.25 million in 1995.
The report said 1997 imports were seen at 800,000 tonnes.
Indonesia took pride in being self-sufficient in rice until 1995 when a prolonged drought damaged crops.
